faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain. EU citizens require only an NIE (tax number), while non-EU citizens follow similar procedures. Spanish law treats foreign and domestic buyers equally. We provide comprehensive guidance through the purchase process, including legal documentation and tax obligations.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs: transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5-1%), registry fees (0.1%), and legal fees (0.5-1.5%). These typically total 8-12% of the property price. Our advisors provide detailed cost breakdowns to ensure complete transparency.
